content: Which famous scientist was awarded the 1921 Nobel Prize in Physics for his services to theoretical physics, and especially for his discovery of the law of the photoelectric effect?

I believe the scientist you're referring to is Albert Einstein. He was awarded the 1921 Nobel Prize in Physics for his services to theoretical physics, particularly for his explanation of the photoelectric effect. This discovery was pivotal in establishing the quantum theory and had a profound impact on the development of modern physics.
